course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Introduction to Chemistry of Cosmetics
course.description: This course concentrates on the basic scientific principles in cosmetic science. Various topics with emphasis on molecular approach related to cosmetic products' formulation and proper uses of cosmetic products will be covered. Major topics include definition of cosmetics, make-up cosmetics, skin-care cosmetics, hair-care cosmetics, vehicles of cosmetic products, surfactants, colorants, alpha hydroxyl acids & beta hydroxyl acids, anti-oxidants and sunscreens, skin-whitening agents, hydrating substances / moisturizers, antiperspirants & deodorants and botanical ingredients.

reviews.author: csjcheung
reviews.title: Interesting content, good teaching
reviews.comment_content: In this course, you can learn how different chemicals in a cosmetic product function, which chemical is useful, and which chemical is just for marketing purposes. You can also learn a bit of the human biology and how the cosmetic products, like skin whitener, work on the human body. Other than purely concepts, students are also required to memorise all of the chemical names and reaction procedures listed in the powerpoints. This course covers many cosmetic products we can see in daily lives. For the syllabus, you can refer to other posts.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Chan is very passionate in teaching. Since this is a common core couse, he tried his best to explain every concept to students who had never taken a single chemistry course, often by drawing. As a student who had learnt chemistry in high school, I sometimes might find his overly-detailed explanation a bit annoying, but I still appreciated his effort. He always welcomed students to ask questions, and he would try his best to explain concepts to students. Overall, he is one of the best teachers I have ever seen.

reviews.comment_workload:
There were only 2 pieces of homework in the course, and they both consisted of only MCs and short questions, so they were easy to finish.

However, the mid-term and final exams required a lot of memorising of chemical reactions, so I do not recommend students who had not learnt chemistry in high school to take this course. On the flip side, if you are good with memorising things, this course may be a breeze for you.

reviews.author: Yan_
reviews.title: Good content but bad grading
reviews.comment_content:
The contents are knowledgeable and interesting. Even though I am not really interested in cosmetics, I still found this course fun and practical as the contents are related to our daily lives. As a business school student who has studied chemistry in secondary school, I think this course is easy to understand and follow.

Here are the topics of the course:
1. Cosmetics & Chemistsâ€™ Perspective; Classification & Production of Cosmetics
2. Vehicles in Cosmetics
3. Surfactants in Cosmetics
4. Hair-Care Cosmetics: Shampoo, Hair-Conditioning and Treatment
5. Hair-Care Cosmetics: Hair Styling Aids
6. Hair Waving & Hair Colors
7. Color Cosmetics: Essence of Makeup
8. Skin-care: Cleansing, AHAs and BHAs
9. Photoaging and Anti-oxidants
10. Skin-whitening Agents
11. Sunscreens
12. Antiperspirants & Deodorants
13. Botanicals for Cosmetics and their Extraction Methods
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Chan is a good professor. He explained the concepts in detail with a lot of drawings and graphs. I think students without a chemistry background can also follow easily. Besides, he also prepared a lot of video clips to show us and he also did experiments in front of the camera even though we were actually having an online lecture. Dr. Chan's teaching makes the course easier to understand and more interesting. The only minor problem is that he usually talks a bit too slow.
reviews.comment_grading:
1. One assignment [20%]
2. 5 quizzes and only the best 4 are counted [60%]
3. Group project [20%]
-Individual Report (4%)
-Presentation (4%)
-TV advertising film (4%)
-Q&A session (8%)

For quizzes, most of them are quite straight forward. Make sure you have watched all the lecture videos and try to understand everything and you can get most of the marks. YET, there are some questions which he has never taught in the lesson. If you have no chem major friends like me, good luck :(

**PLEASE PAY EXTRA ATTENTION TO THE PROJECT Q&A
For the group project, the first three parts are still fine but for the Q&A session, IT IS DISASTROUS.
The Q&A session is divided into an individual question and some group questions. For the individual question, IT IS TOTALLY UNFAIR. Someone can get questions that are super easy which the answers are clearly shown in the ppt and taught the professor during lectures which are even not related to the ingredients of the cosmetics (the project is all about analyzing the ingredients). Yet, someone can get extremely hard questions that require students to take a deep look to the ingredient list and answer something which has never appeared and taught in the lecture. it is awful and what I can say is good luck to you all who decide to take this course in the future. For the group questions, make sure you have already watched, understood, and revised ALL topics before the Q&A session.

I got almost everything above mean except the project Q&A. A- at last but I don't think it is a good grade course at all as the gap between the cut-off score of each sub grading seems to be small. May receive bad grade easily
reviews.comment_workload: A 15min quiz per week with only one assignment and one group project. I think the workload is totally fine for a summer course.

reviews.author: boi
reviews.title: Good Info, Bad Grades, Fair Teaching
reviews.comment_content:
Pros:
- Intro level science (easy for non-science majors)
- Useful / Practical (can identify ingredients in everyday products)
- Interesting / Relevant (he brings up real-life products)
- Comprehensive (you get a good idea of the whole topic)

Cons:
- Sometimes too detailed and impractical (goes into detail on molecules or chemical processes)
- Sometimes very irrelevant (goes very into detail on certain molecules or processes which students taking this course wouldn't be interested in)
- Can be boring at times if you're just here to learn about a very specific thing like skincare or makeup because it covers a lot of different things

Overall, a fun and interesting course. A side note though, if you're here to learn about skincare, I suggest you do it on your own. This course only gives like 2-4 slides on skincare or AHAs and BHAs which I assume most skincare kiddos are here for.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Note: Because courses are online, I rewatched lecture videos in x2 speed.

Pros:
- He talks slowly but is very comprehensive, you can be confident that you'll understand the content

Cons:
- He likes to go into detail on chem related stuff that extends beyond this course or is beyond a 1000 level intro chem course (good for chem students, bad for non chem students)
- Many things he goes into detail on WON'T be quizzed, BUT because you don't know which ones, it can be infuriating (you can't skip anything, have to understand everything)
reviews.comment_grading:
Prof is a scumbag and will often ask things not covered in his course on the quiz. Chem majors thrive.

Summer Course grading:
- 5 Quizzes (Best 4 taken) [60%]
- Homework (Only 1) [20%]
- Group Project [20%]
- Q&A session [??]

Quiz difficulty:
- Fairly straightforward. You HAVE TO listen to every word he says because he often references very small or minor remarks during the lecture in his quizzes. He also quizzes you on things he never taught so make sure you have a chem major friend to help you cheat this scumbag prof.

IMPORTANT:
- The Q&A session is hard af. Make sure you do all the lectures and understand them BEFORE the lecture. Also make sure to know what every single ingredient in your product does. The prof and TAs were ruthless :(

Grading is harsh. Even with most quizzes at mean or above mean, homework and projects around or above mean, it's very likely you'll get a C.
reviews.comment_workload:
Fairly light / normal for a summer class. 3 lectures a week lasting 3 hours each with a quiz every week.

I only took this course during the summer so it wasn't overbearing / felt comfortable.

reviews.comment_teaching:

The experiment also clearly showed some principles in chemistry, such as the viscosity of a skincare product has no relationship with its moisturizing effectiveness.

Dr. Chan had also gone through the exam paper with us, so we can learn from the mistakes and rectify the misconception, instead of just receiving the exam grade.

reviews.title: A good course if you have nothing to do during summer
reviews.comment_content:
others have already listed out the chapters so I guess I won't copy and paste again...
I'm not interested in cosmetics, I hate chemistry, but still I found this course interesting
so i guess if you're curious about how cosmetics work or if you want good grade/fulfill cc requirement, and you are good at memorizing words, this is a suitable course
reviews.comment_teaching:
clear+speaks in a perfect speed that you can watch lecture video in 2X speed, which also means perfect for you to ATTEND the lecture and JOT NOTES (didn't quite able to jot notes with videos in 2X speed)
a nice professor, makes everything so so clear, don't have to worry about the accent
reviews.comment_grading:
5 quizzes (best 4 counted)(60%)
My scoresâ†“
-Q1: 13/13 mean: 10.8
-Q2: 11.5/13 mean: 9.8
-Q3: 13/13 mean: 10.5
-Q4: 11/13 mean: 9
-Q5: 7.5/13 mean: 6.5
So in my case, only Q1-4 were counted, and probably you can tell the difficulty of Quiz 5... don't think you can catch up in quiz 5 cuz it was a VERY VERY DIFFICULT ONE
jot notes+revise ppt+watch lecture video for once is enough to score high in the first four quizzes

Assignment (20%)
one assignment only: 96/100
mean 91.4
JOT NOTES, watch every lecture video and whenever you hear something that doesn't appear on the ppt, WRITE IT DOWN

Group project (20%):
Presentation: 3.75/4
TV advertising film: 3.75/4
you'd need to finish these two with your groupmates, but don't worry cuz it's not demanding, i'd say the presentation part is a bit similar to the individual report in terms of content requirement
My suggestion: do the individual report first
Individual Report: 4/4
the sample given was a lot shorter than mine lol not sure if that's enough, I tend to give very detailed answers though (sometimes toooooo detailed)
My suggestion: search every ingredient listed (not only for the individual report but also the Q&A)
Q&A session:7/8
this part was, unexpectedly, terribly, surprisingly, difficult
My suggestion: JOT NOTES + STUDY THE TOPIC RELATED + study every single ingredient that PERFORMS A FUNCTION MENTIONED in the ppt

got A+
reviews.comment_workload:
light workload, I'm so so satisfied
1 quiz per week only
though you need to watch the videos again and JOT NOTES, if you want good grade
it's really a good course if you got A LOT OF FREE TIME during summer, e.g. no intern, only take one summer course, stay at home everyday (covid-19)

reviews.author: Stellar123
reviews.title: Knowledgable course
reviews.comment_content: Different kinds of cosmetics, their uses, and synthesis.  Some experiments (both video and live demonstrations).
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr.Chan is a very good professor which is very willing to answer questions and answers them fast.  He talks quite slowly during the lesson and he repeats key concepts again and again in a way that students with no chemistry background can easily understand.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grading,  The SD is small though, so make sure you study meticulously.  I recommend you all to print out his PowerPoints and mark down EVERYTHING he said. Luckily quizzes are open book so itâ€™s not that bad (but even the internet wonâ€™t be able to help you much anyway as the knowledge is too specialised).

Some stats for you guys, the number is the % of total course score obtained from each component:
Quizzes (best 4 out of 5)
Me: 52.5 Avg: 46.26
HW
Me: 19.2 Avg:18.28
Project
Me: 16 Avg 16.5

Final grade A-
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload comes from the small SD and the time constraint of quizzes. The amount itself is not too heavy though.  One thing to remind you all though, the quizzes, though non-cummulative supposedly, are still a bit cumulative (I guess itâ€™s the nature of chemistry courses).  For the Q&A session please do research on all ingredients and try to compare between different ingredients that serves similar functions beforehand.  And yes different people get different individual questions for the Q&A.  
And you can rewatch his lecture vids at any time.  Though I recommend going to his lecture, and then review the video again for one more time.

reviews.author: d
reviews.title: Good Grade course
reviews.comment_content:
The contents in this course in quite practical .

In mid term, only 6 chapters will be tested and for the final coverage , it is non-accumulative of mid term content, however, the key concepts in mid-term will be covered. So , this course is not so harsh since the concepts of this course are not hard to understand ,even for the business people.

In both mid-term and final exam, you need to know the name of ingredients in some products , like shampoo,whitening product, sunscreen etc and most important: you just have to recognize the chemical terms but seldom do we need to know the exact spelling of them.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Topics in this course are really interesting
Dennis is willing to answer questions after the lessons
He would do experiments after the lessons which makes the lessons to be more fun!
Notes with great details and easy to follow, also , it is easy to catch the main points in each topic if you pay attention in the lessons
reviews.comment_grading:
I think the grading is quite good and people in this course are easy to score high when comparing to other cc.

According to Canvas,
Mean for assignment 1 is 90 mean for assignment 2 is 35.3/42

mean for experiment project: 39.1/42

Mid term average:44.36/70, s.d. 10.04, maximum: 59/70, Minimum: 20/70

Final : Average 50.01/78
s.d. 14.46
Maximum: 69/78
Minimum:14/78
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not too much (to me):
Mid term (T/F, MCQ,Short Q)
Final exam ( MCQ,Short Q)
2 assignments (one need to handed in before mid-term and one before final)
The first assignment is easy and composed of 3 parts:
T/F, fill in the blanks and some short questions(answers of these can be found in the notes)

The second assignment (there are two options :a  experiment project or another assignment which consists of short questions and a short comprehension question)btw, the 2 assignment is slightly difficult that the first one , still , some answers can be found in the notes

The experiment is to make a DIY beauty product by yourself and there will be a report ( there are some clear guidelines for it and Dennis will explain how to do this in the lesson as well)

reviews.author: Ansongorgor
reviews.comment_content: Content mostly includes the secondary school physics and some basic knowledge of chemistry. There are also some knowledge from A-level chemistry but do no worry as they are easy to understand if you go through all the lecture video.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor will give brief revision and exercise in the beginning of each class, if you can do all the exercises in the power point there will not be any problems in your final and midterm. There are two assignments which are worth to do. 50% of final, 30% of midterm, 20% of assignments
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is nice, if you are above mean one sd, you have high chance to get A- or B+.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is less. There is no point to attend the lecture as there are lecture video. Watching lecture video is more efficient.
